required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Electromagnetic Navigation During Ultrasound Guided Foam Sclerotherapy for Venous Malformations
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility of Electromagnetic Navigation During Ultrasound Guided Foam Sclerotherapy for the Treatment of Venous Malformations.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the feasibility of assisted electromagnetic navigation in percutaneous echo-guided sclerotherapy of slow-flow vascular malformations. Feasibility will be defined in terms of the percentage of patients for whom the procedure is successful.

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary interventional treatment of low flow vascular anomalies includes ultrasound guided foam sclerotherapy. Each procedure involves a percutaneous needle insertion. However, procedures remain complicated to obtain the right trajectory in order to inject the foam at the center of the abnormality. Electromagnetic navigation system tracks the operator's needle, meaning the position and progression of the needle is visualized in 3D real time on the ultrasound probe interface.
The present trial evaluate the feasibility of the electromagnetic navigation system during the needle insertion and the improvement of needle placement accuracy.

primary_outcome.description: Success of procedure a.e. obtention of venous flow at the extremity of the needle permitting the realization of the foam sclerotherapy treatment.

secondary_outcome.description: Number of percutaneous punctures needed to obtain vascular backflow.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the procedure satisfaction by patient
secondary_outcome.description: Satisfaction of the patient throughout the procedure by a questionnaire for patient create by the investigator.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the procedure satisfaction by operator
secondary_outcome.description: Satisfaction of the operator throughout the procedure by a questionnaire for operator create by the investigator..

arm_group.description: The patient have to low Flow Vascular Abnormality diagnosed by Duplex Ultrasound and MRI. Decision of Ultrasound Guided Percutaneous Foam Sclerotherapy taken in multidisciplinary staff meeting

intervention.description: The echo-guided sclerotherapy procedure, assisted by electromagnetic navigation, will be carried out in a clean room during the day hospitalisation and followed by a control Echo-Doppler carried out 2 hours after the procedure.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Low Flow Vascular Abnormality diagnosed by Duplex Ultrasound and MRI
- Decision of Ultrasound Guided Percutaneous Foam Sclerotherapy taken in multidisciplinary staff meeting
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with pacemakers or internal defibrillator
- patients with ferromagnetic implanted material
- patients who are wards of court or under guardianship
- patients deprived of freedom by judicial or administrative decision
- patients under legal protection
- pregnant women
